fileheader.author: Aeromatic , updated Gerard Robin , Ron Jensen (engine and propeller)
fileheader.documentation:
We got some Technical data on the Consolidated PBY-5A, we will partly refer to it : Powerplant 2 × Pratt Whitney R-1830-92 Twin Wasp turbosupercharged radials, rated at 1200 hp (894.59 kW) each Length 63 ft 10.5 inch Height 20 ft 2 inch Empty weight 17526 lb '(7950 kg) Operational weight 34000 lb max Wing Span 104 ft 0 inch Wing Aspect ratio 7.76 Wing Area 1400 sq ft (130 sq m) Service ceiling 14700 ft (61 kg / m2 ) Maximum speed 179 mph at 7000 ft at 23000 lb 207 knt ias at 34000 lb 143 knt ias Stalling at 26000 lb 58-60 kias at 34000 lb 66-70 kias Cruising speed 107 mph at optimum altitude speed for max climb 85 knot to 6000 ft Initial climb rate Climb to 10,000 ft in 19 min 18 sec Range 2545 miles max Fuel capacity internal 1,457 Imp gal (1,750 US gal) Fuel capacity external Metric system Length 19.47 m Height 6.15 m Empty weight 7950 kg Operational weight 15422 kg max Wing Span 31.7 m Wing Aspect ratio 7.76 Wing Area 130.06 m² Service ceiling 4481 m Maximum speed 288 km/h at 2134 m Cruising speed 172 km/h at optimum altitude Initial climb rate Climb to 3050 m in 19 min 18 sec Range 4096 km max Fuel capacity internal 6624 liters
Airfoil NACA0021
